			</beginTargets>
		</command>

Autarch's Assault.description: Kills with the Autarch increase the damage of allied Craftworld Aeldari units in the area.
Autarch's Assault.flavor: The Autarch is the master of warfare, having lived many lives in every Aeldari aspect shrine. Every one of his skilful attacks is both an inspiration to other Aeldari and a lesson in how to conduct war most effectively.
Autarch's Assault.modifiers:
<genericUnitAbility name="Eldar/AutarchsAssault" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Eldar/AutarchsAssaultPassive"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>

Return of the Aeldari.description: Increases the flat amount of resources gained from outposts.
Return of the Aeldari.flavor: After the disappearance of the Old Ones, the Aeldari ruled this planet for millions of years. They understand better than anyone else how to best cultivate and access its unique resources.
Return of the Aeldari.modifiers:
<genericUnitAbility elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" name="Eldar/ReturnOfTheAeldari" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Eldar/ReturnOfTheAeldari"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>

Khaine Awakened.description: Increases the melee attacks and melee damage, decreases the morale loss and grants immunity to fear and pinning to adjacent friendly Aeldari units.
Khaine Awakened.flavor: As the Wailing Doom cries out for blood and the Avatar rouses itself for war, so too are nearby Aeldari driven to greater deeds in his name. Fearing nothing, they throw themselves into the melee battle-crazed.

Vector Dancer.description: Increases the armour against ranged attacks.
Vector Dancer.flavor: Some aircraft are crafted with an eye towards manoeuvrability.
Vector Dancer.modifiers:
<vectorDancer consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="5" requiredActionPoints="0" name="Eldar/VectorDancer">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Eldar/VectorDancer"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</vectorDancer>

Mind War.description: Reduces the accuracy of target enemy unit. Deals damage based on the difference in morale between the Farseer Skyrunner and the target unit.
Mind War.flavor: The Farseer reaches out to attack the mind of an enemy in a desperate mental duel. Foes find their thoughts invaded by the crushing presence of the Farseer, his ancient and inscrutable will extinguishing their personality with horrific ease, triggering a cascade of psychosomatic trauma.
Mind War.modifiers:
<mindWar cooldown="3" name="Eldar/MindWar" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Eldar/MindWar"/>
										<hitpointsFactorFromMoraleDifference addMin="-0.5" addMax="-1.5"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</mindWar>

Doom.description: Increases the damage taken by target enemy unit.
Doom.flavor: With a simple manipulation of that which is to come, the Farseer grants a darkened fate to a chosen foe. While this shadow rests upon the enemy’s soul, death seeks them out above all others, each blow or shot that comes their way rendered inescapably lethal.
Doom.modifiers:
<doom cooldown="3" name="Eldar/Doom" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<noTrait name="Eldar/Doom"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Eldar/Doom"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</doom>

Will of Asuryan.description: Restores the morale of allied units in the area.
Will of Asuryan.flavor: The leader of the Aeldari Gods, Asuryan provided guidance to the growing Aeldari race before his consumption by Slaanesh. The Farseers of Gladius can draw upon his might to bolster their forces, inspiring them to fight on.
Will of Asuryan.modifiers:
<willOfAsuryan cooldown="3" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="Eldar/WillOfAsuryan" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="3">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<morale addMin="2" addMax="6"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</willOfAsuryan>

Linked Fire.description: Increases the damage and armor penetration of target allied Fire Prism’s Prism Cannon.
Linked Fire.flavor: The unusual design of a Fire Prism’s Prism Cannon crystal is designed to allow it to further concentrate its already-intense beam by feeding it into another Fire Prism, focusing both machine’s firepower into a single shot.
Linked Fire.modifiers:
<linkedFire cooldown="1" name="Eldar/LinkedFire">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1" rangeMin="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<type name="Eldar/FirePrism"/>
							<noTrait name="Eldar/LinkedFire"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Eldar/LinkedFire"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</linkedFire>

Crystal Targeting Matrix.flavor: Utilising advanced scanner technologies, this targeting matrix allows pinpoint fire even when on the move.
Crystal Targeting Matrix.modifiers:
<crystalTargetingMatrix consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="5" name="Eldar/CrystalTargetingMatrix" requiredUpgrade="Eldar/CrystalTargetingMatrix">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Eldar/CrystalTargetingMatrix"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</crystalTargetingMatrix>

Vectored Engines.description: Increases the armour against ranged attacks.
Vectored Engines.flavor: Vectored engines allow the pilot of an Aeldari vehicle to rapidly alter its facing, placing deadly weapons, or stronger armour, to the fore. Often, this can mean the difference between sustaining critical damage and taking an indirect blow that can soon be shrugged off.
Vectored Engines.modifiers:
<vectoredEngines consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="5" name="Eldar/VectoredEngines" requiredActionPoints="0" requiredUpgrade="Eldar/VectoredEngines">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Eldar/VectoredEngines"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</vectoredEngines>

Shrouding.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction of this unit and adjacent allied units.
Shrouding.flavor: The psyker uses his mastery of the Warp to fog the minds of his enemies, clouding their sight and instincts so that he appears as nothing more than an indistinct shadow.
Shrouding.modifiers:
<shrouding consumedActionPoints="1" cooldown="3" requiredActionPoints="1" name="Shrouding">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Shrouded"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</shrouding>

Dominate.description: Prevents target enemy infantry or monstrous creature from acting.
Dominate.flavor: The psyker reaches into his foe’s mind, trammelling his soul and crushing his will to fight on.
Dominate.modifiers:
<dominate consumedActionPoints="1" cooldown="1" name="Dominate" requiredActionPoints="1" requiredUpgrade="Eldar/Dominate">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
							<noTrait name="Stunned"/>
							<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Stunned"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</dominate>

War Shout.description: Reduces the morale of adjacent enemy units.
War Shout.flavor: In Aeldari mythology, banshees foreshadow the death of warriors with their howl. The Howling Banshee aspect warriors wear a specialised mask that amplifies and weaponises their thoughts into psychic screams. Whilst their foes are stunned, the Banshees close, power swords at the ready…
War Shout.modifiers:
<warShout consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="3" name="Eldar/WarShout" requiredActionPoints="0" requiredUpgrade="Eldar/WarShout">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<enemy/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<morale add="-3"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</warShout>

Spirit Mark.description: Increases the accuracy of allied Wraithblades and Wraithknights.
Spirit Mark.flavor: The Avatar’s presence invigorates the dead distinctly from the living. Whilst the latter are filled with Khaine’s incandescent rage, those machines manned by spirit crystals instead find their awareness raised from their usual somnambulance, enabling them to better focus on their targets.

Renewer / Destructor.description: Restores the hitpoints of target allied unit or damages target enemy unit.
Renewer / Destructor.flavor: Caging a portion of his psychic might, the Spiritseer sends waves of energy forth to destroy his enemies in a burst of azure flame--or, if the need arises, heal the wounds of his allies.
Renewer / Destructor.modifiers:
<destructorRenewer cooldown="2" name="Eldar/DestructorRenewer" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<damage mulMin="0.0" mulMax="1.0"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit/>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints addMin="4" addMax="12"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<enemy/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<weaponDamage weapon="Destructor"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</destructorRenewer>

Protect / Jinx.description: Increases the armour of target allied unit or decreases the armour of target enemy unit.
Protect / Jinx.flavor: Chained by runes of power, fate itself is bound to the Spiritseer’s will.
Protect / Jinx.modifiers:
<protectJinx cooldown="2" name="Eldar/ProtectJinx" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit/>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Eldar/Protect"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<enemy/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Eldar/Jinx"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</protectJinx>

Embolden / Horrify.description: Restores the morale of target allied unit or decreases the morale of target enemy unit.
Embolden / Horrify.flavor: The Spiritseer calls down the splendour of battle, instilling his allies with valour or sapping courage from his foes.
Embolden / Horrify.modifiers:
<emboldenHorrify cooldown="2" name="Eldar/EmboldenHorrify" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit/>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<morale addMin="3" addMax="9"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<enemy/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<morale addMin="-3" addMax="-9"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</emboldenHorrify>

Hallucination.description: Decreases the attacks of target enemy unit.
Hallucination.flavor: Paranoia, confusion and panic are heightened to a debilitating degree as the telepath alters his foes’ perceptions.
Hallucination.modifiers:
<hallucination cooldown="3" elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" name="Hallucination" rank="-1" rankMax="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<noTrait name="Hallucination"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="3" name="Hallucination"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</hallucination>

Gate of Infinity.flavor: The psyker punches a corridor through the roiling Immaterium, allowing him to cross great distances in the blink of an eye.

Hammerhand.flavor: Focussing the raging power of his mind, the psyker augments the strength of his comrades to the point where they can crush flesh and bone with a single blow.
Hammerhand.modifiers:
<hammerhand consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="3" requiredActionPoints="0" name="Hammerhand" psychicPower="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Hammerhand"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</hammerhand>

Necrodermis Repair.flavor: If a Necron is only mildly damaged, their living metal body can somewhat heal itself, flowing reserve metals to cover flaws and failings.
Necrodermis Repair.modifiers:
<necrodermisRepair consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="1" name="Necrons/NecrodermisRepair" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="60"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="Necrons/NecrodermisRepair3">
					<effects>
						<cooldown max="0"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<damaged/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints add="6"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
								<modifier requiredUpgrade="Necrons/NecrodermisRepair2">
									<effects>
										<hitpoints add="2"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</necrodermisRepair>

Quantum Shielding.description: Increases the invulnerable damage reduction. Goes on cooldown at the start of the next turn if damage is taken.
Quantum Shielding.flavor: Necron quantum shielding is a marvel of science, existing only at the precise moment of deflection—at all other times there is no indication of its presence. They are, however, temperamental devices, prone to malfunction if overloaded.

Found City (Necrons).description:
Consumes the unit to found a new city.

Necron cities can only be found on top of Necron Tombs and if there are no other cities within a 4 tile radius. Each city after the first decreases loyalty in all cities by 6.
Found City (Necrons).modifiers:
<foundCity name="FoundCityNecrons" icon="Actions/FoundCity">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<energyCost base="40"/>
						<influenceCost base="40"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>	
			<beginTargets>
				<target>
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<feature name="NecronTomb"/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</foundCity>

Scarab Hive.flavor: Canoptek Scarabs sweep across the battlefield in vast, undulating swarms that devour all in their path. Mindless feeding machines, the Scarabs are constructs designed to break down matter into raw energy that can then be woven into fresh forms. Within the confines of a tomb this process is one of clearing and manufacture, but on the battlefield it is a powerful force of destruction.
Scarab Hive.modifiers:
<scarabHive cooldown="5" icon="Units/Necrons/CanoptekScarab" name="Necrons/ScarabHive" requiredUpgrade="Necrons/ScarabHive">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<energyCost base="20"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<land/>
							<noUnit/>
							<noFeature name="GravityWaves"/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addUnit name="Necrons/CanoptekScarab" consumedAction="0" consumedMovement="0"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</scarabHive>

Fabricator Claw Array.description: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied vehicle or fortification unit.
Fabricator Claw Array.flavor: This clicking, whirring proliferation of energy tools is primarily intended for maintenance and repair.
Fabricator Claw Array.modifiers:
<fabricatorClawArray cooldown="1" name="Necrons/FabricatorClawArray">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<damaged/>
						</unit>
						<unit match="Any">
							<trait name="Fortification"/>
							<trait name="Vehicle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints add="8"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</fabricatorClawArray>

Gloom Prism.description: Increases the witchfire damage reduction of the Canoptek Spyder and adjacent allied units.
Gloom Prism.flavor: The gloom prism's energy field creates a zone shrouded from Warp-spawned powers.
Gloom Prism.modifiers:
<genericUnitAbility name="Necrons/GloomPrism" passive="1" requiredUpgrade="Necrons/GloomPrism">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Necrons/GloomPrism"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>

Dimensional Corridor.description: Teleports to a tile adjacent to a city or Monolith.
Dimensional Corridor.flavor:
“And first to walk the starlight bridge, from incorporeal to corporeal, was Artemorra, to whom the Necrontyr gave the name 'Messenger', later changed to 'Deceiver'—with good reason.”
  — Fragmentary inscription on a Jokaerian Defence Orb
Dimensional Corridor.modifiers:
<dimensionalCorridor cooldown="3" name="Necrons/DimensionalCorridor" requiredUpgrade="Necrons/DimensionalCorridor">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="30"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="Necrons/DimensionalCorridor2">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost mul="-0.33"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="Necrons/DimensionalCorridor3">
					<effects>
						<consumedActionPoints max="0"/>
						<consumedMovement max="0"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
		</dimensionalCorridor>

Resurrection Orb.description: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied unit.
Resurrection Orb.flavor: This glowing sphere focuses energy into the regeneration circuits of nearby Necrons, enhancing their ability to self-repair.
Resurrection Orb.modifiers:
<resurrectionOrb cooldown="3" levelUpPriority="0.15" name="Necrons/ResurrectionOrb" rank="-1" rankMax="2"> 
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<damaged/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints addMin="6" addMax="18"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</resurrectionOrb>

Chronometron.description: Increases damage reduction of the target allied unit.
Chronometron.flavor: These eye-shaped devices project a bubble of energy that can alter the flow of time itself, slowing incoming projectiles such that those nearby can simply move out of their path.
Chronometron.modifiers:
<chronometron cooldown="1" levelUpPriority="0.1" name="Necrons/Chronometron" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Necrons/Chronometron"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</chronometron>

Mindshackle Scarabs.description: Reduces the morale of the target enemy unit.
Mindshackle Scarabs.flavor: At the bearer's command, tiny mindshackle scarabs burrow into their target's brain, bypassing cerebral functions and robbing the unfortunate victim of their wits.
Mindshackle Scarabs.modifiers:
<mindshackleScarabs cooldown="1" name="Necrons/MindshackleScarabs" rank="-1" rankMax="2"> 
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="3">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<noTrait name="AndTheyShallKnowNoFear"/>
							<noTrait name="Fearless"/>
							<noTrait name="Zealot"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<morale addMin="-4" addMax="-12"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</mindshackleScarabs>

Solar Pulse.description: Reduces the accuracy of enemy infantry and monstrous creature units in the area.
Solar Pulse.flavor: The Solar Staff burns with the light of truth and honour, and when its powers are unleashed they are a bane to all shadows. Set loose, the staff's energies blaze outward in a mighty flare, as though a new sun was born. The darkness is driven back by this false dawn, and the foe reels as their eyes are blinded and their deceptions are laid bare.
Solar Pulse.modifiers:
<solarPulse cooldown="5" elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" name="Necrons/SolarPulse" rank="-1" rankMax="0"> 
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="3">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<enemy/>
											<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
											<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Blind"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</solarPulse>

Hunters from Hyperspace.description: Teleports to target explored tile and increases damage.
Hunters from Hyperspace.flavor: These deadly marksmen seldom take position with the rest of the army. Instead, they slip sideways out of reality and monitor the conflict from a hyperspace oubliette – a pocket dimension riding the gap between the then and now. The Deathmarks track enemy communication channels, teleport beams and orbital descents in order to select suitably high-profile prey. This done, they exit their oubliette to tag their quarry with the hunter’s mark from which they take their name – an eerie green energy halo that plays about the target’s head in five dimensions.
Hunters from Hyperspace.modifiers:
<huntersFromHyperspace cooldown="10" consumedActionPoints="0" name="Necrons/HuntersFromHyperspace" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="20"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<endTargets>
				<target>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Necrons/HuntersFromHyperspace"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</endTargets>
		</huntersFromHyperspace>

Jet Charge.description: Increases damage reduction and flies across obstacles to the target tile.
Jet Charge.flavor: In its limitless rage, a headstrong Necron Destroyer Lord can overcharge its grav-platform to move short distances extremely quickly, albeit at a further cost to its reason.
Jet Charge.modifiers:
<jetCharge cooldown="3" name="Necrons/JetCharge" rank="-1" rankMax="2"> 
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<movement add="1"/>
						<movementMax add="1"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Necrons/JetCharge"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
								<modifier requiredUpgrade="Necrons/HammerOfWrath">
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="HammerOfWrath"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</jetCharge>

Bloody Crusade.flavor: In its desire to rid the universe of organic life, a Destroyer Lord can descend into a savage insanity, raining blow after blow on its opponents, far beyond safe protocols.
Bloody Crusade.modifiers:
<bloodyCrusade name="Necrons/BloodyCrusade" levelUpPriority="0.1" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Necrons/BloodyCrusade"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</bloodyCrusade>

Destruction Protocols.description: Increases the damage taken for adjacent enemy units.
Destruction Protocols.flavor: When a Necron Lord falls to the Destroyer curse, they abandon the caution and of their Defensive Protocols, reconfiguring their engrammic pathways to augment the aggression of their peers, not their defensive capabilities.
Destruction Protocols.modifiers:
<destructionProtocols name="Necrons/DestructionProtocols" levelUpPriority="0.1" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Necrons/DestructionProtocols"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</destructionProtocols>

Reaper.description: Increases the armour and accuracy. Jet Charge recharges when the Destroyer Lord gains experience from combat.
Reaper.flavor: Where the Flayers suffer the deathcurse of Llandu'gor, the Destroyers' madness derives from the universal fate of all Necrons—the loss of their souls when they took on living metal bodies. In the Destroyers, this drives them to refine themselves more and more, to become closer to perfect weapons—curiously, thus, closer to Aza'gorod, the Nightbringer, the doom of all life.
Reaper.modifiers:
<reaper cooldown="10" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" name="Necrons/Reaper" rank="-1" rankMax="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="3" name="Necrons/Reaper"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</reaper>

Phase Shift Generator.description: Increases the invulnerable damage reduction of the Gauss Pylon and adjacent allied Necron units.
Phase Shift Generator.flavor: When a Gauss Pylon is raised from the ground, it creates a temporal bubble altering the local flow of space time. Nearby Necrons can take advantage of this, shifting out of phase with reality to avoid destruction.

Repair Barge.description: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied Necron infantry or monstrous creature unit.
Repair Barge.flavor: Stately they might be, but these sinister vehicles are as great a threat as the better-known Monolith. Their role is to support the Necron army, gliding across the battlefield and disgorging minute repair scarabs to return even the most devastated Necron warriors to battle readiness, before transporting them back to the fray.
Repair Barge.modifiers:
<blessingsOfTheOmnissiah cooldown="1" name="Necrons/RepairBarge">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<damaged/>
							<faction name="Necrons"/>
							<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
							<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints add="8"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</blessingsOfTheOmnissiah>

Construct Gauss Pylon.description: Powerful defence turret that shields allied Necron units.
Construct Gauss Pylon.flavor: The mysterious Necron defence turrets, designated as 'Pylons' by those who originally encountered them, were first recorded on the uncharted world of WDY-272. Rising suddenly from the desert sands, the Gauss Pylons opened fire without warning and with devastating effect, tanks and armoured carriers burning as the crescent-shaped weapons tore through the unsuspecting Imperial Guard column whilst resisting all return fire.
Construct Gauss Pylon.modifiers:
<constructGaussPylon icon="Units/Necrons/GaussPylon" requiredUpgrade="Necrons/GaussPylon" cooldown="5">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<influenceCost base="240"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="3">
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<noFeatureCategory name="Resource"/>
							<noFeatureCategory name="WireWeed"/>
							<land/>
							<noEnemyCity/>
							<noUnit/>
							<noFeature name="GravityWaves"/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addUnit name="Necrons/GaussPylon"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</constructGaussPylon>

Void Strike.description: Performs a Voidblade attack with increased attacks.
Void Strike.flavor:
“The best weapon is the one that you never have to use.”
  — Kanaa the Tranquil, Necron Cryptek, creator of the Void Strike
Void Strike.modifiers:
<voidStrike cooldown="3" name="Necrons/VoidStrike" rank="-1" rankMax="2" weaponSlotName="Voidblade">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<attacks addMin="6" addMax="12"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
		</voidStrike>

Defensive Protocols.description: Increases the armour of the Lord and allied Necron units in range.
Defensive Protocols.flavor: A Necron’s Lords higher functions aren’t devoted to containing a more-charming personality or a fiercer intelligence—they also contain control protocols that enable them to coordinate nearby Necron troops more minutely, heavily increasing their chances of survival.
Defensive Protocols.modifiers:
<defensiveProtocols cooldown="3" levelUpPriority="0.15" name="Necrons/DefensiveProtocols" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radiusMin="1" radiusMax="3">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<faction name="Necrons"/>
											
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Necrons/DefensiveProtocols"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</defensiveProtocols>

Dynasty.description: Increases the population limit of cities.
Dynasty.flavor: It’s a truism that the greatest leaders attract the largest numbers of followers—or in the case of the Necrons, the greatest leaders have wider security permissions over their Canoptek maintenance units, enabling a higher population density in a given location.
Dynasty.modifiers:
<dynasty name="Necrons/Dynasty" levelUpPriority="0.1" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Necrons/Dynasty"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</dynasty>

Royal Guard.flavor:
“I have watched the galaxy for sixty million years. I have raised civilisations to our ways and seen them thrive, fade and pass into myth. And I still believe that to exist without honour, without laws—well, it is better not to exist at all.”
  — Eystan, Triarch Praetorian
Royal Guard.modifiers:
<royalGuard cooldown="5" elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" name="Necrons/RoyalGuard" rank="-1" rankMax="0"> 
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<land/>
							<noUnit/>
							<noFeature name="GravityWaves"/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>

“The Orks are the pinnacle of creation. For them, the great struggle is won. They have evolved a society which knows no stress or angst. Who are we to judge them? We Aeldari who have failed, or the Humans, on the road to ruin in their turn? And why? Because we sought answers to questions that an Ork wouldn't even bother to ask! We see a culture that is strong and despise it as crude.”
  — Uthan the Perverse, Aeldari Philosopher

			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="Broken"/>

				<unit match="Any">

				<modifier requiredUpgrade="SistersOfBattle/SimulacrumImperialis">

			<beginTargets>

						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
