									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</thePassion>

Lead The Righteous.description: Increases the accuracy of this unit and nearby allied Adepta Sororitas infantry units.
Lead The Righteous.flavor:
“A Canoness is no skulking commissar, to hide behind her sisters’ skirts and send them to her deaths. My role is to lead from the front, to inspire love and faith by my example. For we are the righteous of the Emperor and we will not fail in our aim.”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Memoriam De Virtute
Lead The Righteous.modifiers:
<leadTheRighteous cooldown="3" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="SistersOfBattle/LeadTheRighteous" requiredActionPoints="0" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="2">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
											<faction name="SistersOfBattle"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/LeadTheRighteous"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</leadTheRighteous>

Death Before Disgrace.description: Restores the morale of the target allied unit.
Death Before Disgrace.flavor:
“What is death, to us? We are not fodder for laughing gods. We are not enshrined in stones, like the foul Aeldari. For us death is an end to service, a reward only given if we do not seek it. So act as if each moment is your last, but strive against that day with all your heart.”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Memoriam De Virtute
Death Before Disgrace.modifiers:
<deathBeforeDisgrace cooldown="3" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="SistersOfBattle/DeathBeforeDisgrace" requiredActionPoints="0" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<faction name="SistersOfBattle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<morale addMin="3" addMax="9"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</deathBeforeDisgrace>

Divine Deliverance.description: This unit and adjacent allied Adepta Sororitas units cause attacked units to lose morale.
Divine Deliverance.flavor: Enemy warlords tremble before the divine majesty of one blessed by the Emperor, and their minions quake before the booming onslaught of such a warrior’s companions.
Divine Deliverance.modifiers:
<genericUnitAbility passive="1" name="SistersOfBattle/DivineDeliverance" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="SistersOfBattle/DivineDeliverance"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>

Righteous Judgement.description: Ignores ranged damage reduction and increases damage taken by the target enemy unit.
Righteous Judgement.flavor: None can escape the Emperor’s judgement, and wherever the foe attempts to seek shelter the shots of the Adepta Sororitas miraculously seek them out.
Righteous Judgement.modifiers:
<righteousJudgement cooldown="3" elite="1" name="SistersOfBattle/RighteousJudgement" levelUpPriority="1" rank="-1" rankMax="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="3">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/RighteousJudgement"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</righteousJudgement>

Laud Hailer.description: Adjacent Adepta Sororitas units can perform Acts of Faith even if they are shaken.
Laud Hailer.flavor: Proclaiming the power of the Emperor in heavenly tones, a Laud Hailer bolsters the spirits of the faithful.
Laud Hailer.modifiers:
<genericUnitAbility passive="1" name="SistersOfBattle/LaudHailer" requiredUpgrade="SistersOfBattle/LaudHailer">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" excludeRadius="0" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="SistersOfBattle/LaudHailer"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>

Bodyguard.description: Grants additional protection to adjacent allied heroes.
Bodyguard.flavor: Celestians are those Sisters most filled with martial spirit, proving themselves in the most intense melees. They frequently serve as bodyguards and champions of Canonesses, willingly sacrificing themselves to protect their charge.

Keepers of the Faith.description:
Prevents overwatch but increases the damage reduction if this unit has actions remaining.

Act of Faith. Usable if the unit is not shaken or broken.
Keepers of the Faith.flavor:
“Reason says, fire when you see the enemy. Reason says, use cover when the enemy fires at you. Reason says, die when you are shot. Reason does not understand our faith and how we keep it.”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Nomine Strategi
Keepers of the Faith.modifiers:
<genericUnitAbility disableable="1" passive="1" name="SistersOfBattle/KeepersOfTheFaith">
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<actionPoints greater="0"/>
					<noTrait name="Broken"/>
				</unit>
				<unit match="Any">
					<noTrait name="Shaken"/>
					<trait name="SistersOfBattle/LaudHailer"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="SistersOfBattle/KeepersOfTheFaith"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>

Flank Speed.description: Increases the movement, but prevents the use of ranged weapons.
Flank Speed.flavor:
“One should not question the nobility of Questor Imperialis. But for faith, none can match the Knight-Lancer, which goes into battle armed only with a spear and its own prodigious speed, praying that it makes it to the enemy lines. It is a fine match for our forces.”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Nomine Strategi
Flank Speed.modifiers:
<flankSpeed consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="1" name="SistersOfBattle/FlankSpeed" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<notAttackedThisTurn/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/FlankSpeed"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</flankSpeed>

Endless Crusade.description:
Gains Fleet and Move Through Cover.

Act of Faith. Usable if the unit is not shaken or broken.
Endless Crusade.flavor: Limbs do not tire when the spirit of the Emperor moves them, but find fresh strength in the righteous work to come.
Endless Crusade.modifiers:
<endlessCrusade consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="10" name="SistersOfBattle/EndlessCrusade" requiredActionPoints="0" requiredMovement="1">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="SistersOfBattle/SimulacrumImperialis">
					<effects>
						<cooldown mul="-0.5"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="Broken"/>
				</unit>
				<unit match="Any">
					<noTrait name="Shaken"/>
					<trait name="SistersOfBattle/LaudHailer"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Fleet"/>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="MoveThroughCover"/>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/UsedActOfFaith"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</endlessCrusade>

Verse of Holy Piety.description: Reduces the cooldown of Acts of Faith on the target unit.
Verse of Holy Piety.flavor: Pray is stronger than any sword. As the sanctified words of the Order’s holy tenets are roared across the battlefield, the devout are infused with the Emperor’s blessings.
Verse of Holy Piety.modifiers:
<verseOfHolyPiety cooldown="1" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="SistersOfBattle/VerseOfHolyPiety" requiredActionPoints="0" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
						</unit>
						<unit match="Any">
							<cooldownAction name="SistersOfBattle/EndlessCrusade"/>
							<cooldownAction name="SistersOfBattle/ThePassion"/>
							<cooldownAction name="SistersOfBattle/SolaceInAnguish"/>
							<cooldownAction name="SistersOfBattle/MiraculousIntervention"/>
							<cooldownAction name="SistersOfBattle/LightOfTheEmperor"/>
							<cooldownAction name="SistersOfBattle/DivineGuidance"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="UnitAction">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit match="Any">
											<cooldownAction name="SistersOfBattle/EndlessCrusade"/>
											<cooldownAction name="SistersOfBattle/ThePassion"/>
											<cooldownAction name="SistersOfBattle/SolaceInAnguish"/>
											<cooldownAction name="SistersOfBattle/MiraculousIntervention"/>
											<cooldownAction name="SistersOfBattle/LightOfTheEmperor"/>
											<cooldownAction name="SistersOfBattle/DivineGuidance"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<cooldown addMin="-3" addMax="-9"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</verseOfHolyPiety>

Catechism of Repugnance.description: Increases the ranged accuracy and ranged armor penetration of the target Adepta Sororitas allied unit.
Catechism of Repugnance.flavor: With the holy bolter we shall cleanse the mutant, the alien and the heretic. With the Emperor’s gift do we deliver our hatred of the defiler.
Catechism of Repugnance.modifiers:
<catechismOfRepugnance cooldown="1" consumedActionPoints="1" consumedMovement="0" name="SistersOfBattle/CatechismOfRepugnance" requiredActionPoints="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<faction name="SistersOfBattle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/CatechismOfRepugnance"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</catechismOfRepugnance>

Stirring Rhetoric.description: This unit and nearby allied units that used an Act of Faith gain additional armor.
Stirring Rhetoric.flavor:
“There is no light but the light of the Emperor! There is no faith but faith in the Emperor! There is no truth but the truth of the Emperor!”
  — First Exclamation of the Dialogus Order of the Resounding Vow
Stirring Rhetoric.modifiers:
<genericUnitAbility passive="1" name="SistersOfBattle/StirringRhetoric" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="2">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="SistersOfBattle/StirringRhetoric"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>

War Hymn.description: Increases the melee attacks of the target Adepta Sororitas non-super-heavy allied unit.
War Hymn.flavor: Suffer not the enemies of Mankind to live. Smite them down with all your strength and fury.
War Hymn.modifiers:
<warHymn cooldown="3" elite="1" name="SistersOfBattle/WarHymn" consumedMovement="0" consumedActionPoints="1" requiredActionPoints="1" levelUpPriority="1" rank="-1" rankMax="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<faction name="SistersOfBattle"/>
							<noTrait name="SuperHeavy"/>
						</unit>
						<weapon>
							<trait name="Melee"/>
						</weapon>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="2" name="SistersOfBattle/WarHymn"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</warHymn>

Divine Guidance.description:
Increases the damage and armour penetration.

Act of Faith. Usable if the unit is not shaken or broken.
Divine Guidance.flavor: As the combatants of the sorority recite rites of destruction, their aim faithfully falls where it will cause the most harm – every shot and every strike becoming a mortal blow that condemns another heretic to oblivion.
Divine Guidance.modifiers:
<divineGuidance consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="10" name="SistersOfBattle/DivineGuidance" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="SistersOfBattle/SimulacrumImperialis">
					<effects>
						<cooldown mul="-0.5"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="Broken"/>
				</unit>
				<unit match="Any">
					<noTrait name="Shaken"/>
					<trait name="SistersOfBattle/LaudHailer"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Rending"/>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/UsedActOfFaith"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</divineGuidance>

Sacred Healing.description: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied infantry unit.
Sacred Healing.flavor: Implements of both torture and salvation, the chirurgeon’s tools can restore the fallen so that they might fight once more.
Sacred Healing.modifiers:
<sacredHealing cooldown="1" name="SistersOfBattle/SacredHealing">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<damaged/>
							<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
							<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints add="6"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</sacredHealing>

Medicus Ministorum.description: Grants feel no pain damage reduction to adjacent allied infantry units.
Medicus Ministorum.flavor: A Medicus Ministorum is a medical field kit used by members of the Adeptus Ministorum and by the Hospitallers of the Adepta Sororitas. Contained within a rare scentwood box are a collection of relics which are used to cure all manner of injuries and ailments.

Tale of the Warrior.description: Increases the melee damage of adjacent Adepta Sororitas infantry units.
Tale of the Warrior.flavor: When the Imagifiers chant their tales of ancient battles of Istvaan V, of Sanguinius at the Eternity Gate, of Horus’ downfall, the Battle Sisters become suffused with the martial spirit of their forebears, every blow landing like the Emperor’s fist.
Tale of the Warrior.modifiers:
<taleOfTheWarrior consumedActionPoints="1" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="1" name="SistersOfBattle/TaleOfTheWarrior" requiredActionPoints="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1" excludeRadius="0">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
											<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
											<faction name="SistersOfBattle"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/TaleOfTheWarrior"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</taleOfTheWarrior>

Tale of the Stoic.description: Increases the damage reduction of this unit and adjacent Adepta Sororitas infantry units.
Tale of the Stoic.flavor: Hearing the stories of the Emperor’s eternal suffering and silent resilience, each Sister is filled with His courage. Their will-to-fight in His name is indefatigable and they push through injuries so grievous that an average man would be long-dead from shock. Yet they are neither average nor men.
Tale of the Stoic.modifiers:
<taleOfTheStoic consumedActionPoints="1" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="1" name="SistersOfBattle/TaleOfTheStoic" requiredActionPoints="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
											<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
											<faction name="SistersOfBattle"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/TaleOfTheStoic"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</taleOfTheStoic>

Tale of the Faithful.description: Increases the movement of this unit and adjacent Adepta Sororitas infantry units.
Tale of the Faithful.flavor: From a young age, the initiates of the Adepta Sororitas exercise and pray backed by the sonorous songs of the Imagifiers, inspired to superhuman feats by the testaments of their long-dead sisters. Even cynical veterans, hearing the song in their dotage, are inspired to transcend their body’s limitations, moving with impossible swiftness and blessed grace.
Tale of the Faithful.modifiers:
<taleOfTheFaithful consumedActionPoints="1" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="1" name="SistersOfBattle/TaleOfTheFaithful" requiredActionPoints="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
											<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
											<faction name="SistersOfBattle"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/TaleOfTheFaithful"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</taleOfTheFaithful>

Agile.description: Increases the movement, but decreases the attacks.
Agile.flavor: Size doesn’t preclude speed. Look at the incredible manoeuvrability of the Imperium’s Lightning Fighter. Or take the Tyranid’s Hierodule. Instead of lumbering forward like a lumpen Ogryn, their focus and grace is closer to that of a Harlequin. A hungry Harlequin the size of a house, admittedly, with acid drool and scytheblade arms the length of a Land Raider, that is. But elegant all the same.
Agile.modifiers:
<agile name="Agile" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="3" consumedActionPoints="0" requiredActionPoints="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Agile"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</agile>

Miraculous Intervention.description:
After dying, Saint Celestine immediately comes back to life.

Act of Faith. Usable if the unit is not shaken or broken.
Miraculous Intervention.flavor: Not even death can stop the Emperor’s chosen servants, and through his benevolence they rise again to serve the Master of Mankind’s will.
Miraculous Intervention.modifiers:
<miraculousIntervention beginOnDisappear="1" cooldown="10" name="SistersOfBattle/MiraculousIntervention" passive="1">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="SistersOfBattle/SimulacrumImperialis">
					<effects>
						<cooldown mul="-0.5"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="SistersOfBattle/MiraculousIntervention"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<destroyed/>
											<noTrait name="Broken"/>
										</unit>
										<unit match="Any">
											<noTrait name="Shaken"/>
											<trait name="SistersOfBattle/LaudHailer"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<hitpointsFactorFromMax add="1.0"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</miraculousIntervention>

Beacon of Faith.description: Restore the morale of this unit and nearby allied units.
Beacon of Faith.flavor:
“The Khornate warriors threatened to overwhelm us, we were cut and rent and thrown aside… even the Canoness fell… and then She intervened. As She descended, a shining beacon, our wounds closed, our spirits rallied and we drove back the heretics with newfound devotion…”
  — Unknown remembrancer, Gospel of the Webway
Beacon of Faith.modifiers:
<beaconOfFaith cooldown="5" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="SistersOfBattle/BeaconOfFaith" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="2">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<morale addMin="2" addMax="6"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</beaconOfFaith>

Healing Tears.description: Restores a portion of Saint Celestine's hitpoints.
Healing Tears.flavor:
“And, lo, the tears were human, tears for her lost sisters, tears for the endless war—but they were transfigured in their descent and where they struck, they blessed. And the Saint herself roused herself up with righteous fury…”
  — Unknown remembrancer, Gospel of the Webway
Healing Tears.modifiers:
<healingTears cooldown="3" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="SistersOfBattle/HealingTears" requiredActionPoints="0" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<damaged/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpointsFactorFromMax addMin="0.1" addMax="0.3"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</healingTears>

Saintly Blessings.description: Grants additional damage reduction to this unit and adjacent allied units.
Saintly Blessings.flavor: In the presence of an ordained Living Saint, even the most impious of the Emperor’s servants cannot help but be swept up by the tide of religious fervour.
Saintly Blessings.modifiers:
<genericUnitAbility passive="1" name="SistersOfBattle/SaintlyBlessings" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="SistersOfBattle/SaintlyBlessings"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>

The Emperor's Vengeance.description: Calls down a divine ray to bombard enemy positions.
The Emperor's Vengeance.flavor:
“This was not in the doctrines, nor the ephemera, nor even the apocrypha. This planet had drained the Saint, it is true. But at moments of great wrath, her true power broke through, all at once, and devastated those who dared to stand against her.”
  — Unknown remembrancer, Gospel of the Webway
The Emperor's Vengeance.modifiers:
<theEmperorsVengeance cooldown="5" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" requiredActionPoints="0" elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" rank="-1" rankMax="0" name="SistersOfBattle/TheEmperorsVengeance">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<enemy/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<weaponDamage weapon="TheEmperorsVengeance"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</theEmperorsVengeance>

Solace in Anguish.description:
Increases the damage reduction.

Act of Faith. Usable if the unit is not shaken or broken.
Solace in Anguish.flavor:
“I had seen a Preacher impaled on a steeple. The remains of a missionary found by genestealer cultists. We felt the loss so strongly—but our anguish did not weaken us, but spurred us on…”
  — Unknown remembrancer, Gospel of the Webway
Solace in Anguish.modifiers:
<solaceInAnguish consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="10" name="SistersOfBattle/SolaceInAnguish" requiredActionPoints="0">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="SistersOfBattle/SimulacrumImperialis">
					<effects>
						<cooldown mul="-0.5"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="Broken"/>
				</unit>
				<unit match="Any">
					<noTrait name="Shaken"/>
					<trait name="SistersOfBattle/LaudHailer"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/SolaceInAnguish"/>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SistersOfBattle/UsedActOfFaith"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</solaceInAnguish>

Narthecium.description: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied infantry or monstrous creature unit.
Narthecium.flavor: The narthecium is used by Space Marine Apothecaries to dispense medical aid, including complex battlefield surgery, to the wounded. The wrist-mounted device also houses a reductor—the mechanism with which the gene-seed of the fallen is recovered, ensuring the Chapter's future.
Narthecium.modifiers:
<narthecium cooldown="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<damaged/>
							<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
							<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints add="8"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</narthecium>

Orbital Deployment.description: Deploys the unit from a city tile to the target tile.
Orbital Deployment.flavor: Some units make their way to battle via tunnelling, teleportation, flying or some other extraordinary means which allows them to appear in the thick of the fighting.

Power Strike.description: Performs a Power Sword attack with increased damage.
Power Strike.flavor:
“My sword is at the Emperor's command. I answer to no other man, living or dead.”
  — Tu'shan, Chapter Master of the Salamanders
Power Strike.modifiers:
<powerStrike cooldown="3" icon="Actions/PowerStrike" rank="-1" rankMax="2" weaponSlotName="PowerSword">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<damage mulMin="0.5" mulMax="1.5"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
		</powerStrike>

Healing Surge.flavor:
“I haven't lost an arm, brother. It's right over there.”
  — Captain Alessio Cortez, Crimson Fists
Healing Surge.modifiers:
<healingSurge cooldown="3" levelUpPriority="0.15" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<damaged/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpointsFactorFromMax addMin="0.2" addMax="0.4"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</healingSurge>

Deeds of Glory.description: When gaining experience from combat the chapter gains influence.
Deeds of Glory.flavor:
“It is a captain's duty to place legionary lives in harm's way before his own. There is too little glory in the galaxy to go around and officers must be generous in the trust they place in others—for one day such brothers must be captains too.”
  — Rouboute Guilliman, Primarch of the Ultramarines, Lord Commander and Imperial Regent
Deeds of Glory.modifiers:
<deedsOfGlory passive="1" levelUpPriority="0.2" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="DeedsOfGlory"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</deedsOfGlory>

Orbital Strike.description: Calls down an orbital strike upon the target enemy unit.
Orbital Strike.modifiers:
<orbitalStrike cooldown="5" elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" rank="-1" rankMax="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="-1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<weaponDamage weapon="OrbitalBombardment"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</orbitalStrike>

Rites of War.description: Increases the damage of the Chaplain and adjacent allied units.
Rites of War.flavor: Honour-bound by sacred oaths of fealty to the Imperium, the Chaplain and his warriors vow before the Chapter and the Emperor to secure victory at any cost.
Rites of War.modifiers:
<ritesOfWar cooldown="3" levelUpPriority="0.1" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="RitesOfWar"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</ritesOfWar>

Canticles of Wrath.description: Restores the morale of this unit and adjacent allied units and reduces the morale of adjacent enemy units.
Canticles of Wrath.flavor: Amplified through his vox grill, the Chaplain's bellicose rhetoric and canticles of wrath echo like thunder across the battlefield, filling the Space Marines with new strength while causing the enemy to cower in terror.
Canticles of Wrath.modifiers:
<canticlesOfWrath cooldown="3" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<morale addMin="2" addMax="6"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<enemy/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<morale addMin="-2" addMax="-6"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</canticlesOfWrath>

Dogma Astartes.description: Increases the loyalty output of the fortress-city.
Dogma Astartes.flavor: The Chaplains of the Space Marines are grim spiritual guardians, whose first duty is to be ever watchful for the dangers of pride, doubt and heresy. Daunting even to their own brethren, Chaplains rely on dogma and liturgy to keep their brothers from spiritual corruption.
Dogma Astartes.modifiers:
<dogmaAstrates passive="1" levelUpPriority="0.5" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="DogmaAstrates"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</dogmaAstrates>

Oration of Restoration.description: Restores the hitpoints of the Chaplain and adjacent allied units each turn.
Oration of Restoration.flavor:
“At battle's end, speak the Liturgy in a clear voice. Respect the bravery of the living. Give the Rite of Passage to the fallen. Honour the battle gear of the dead. To do all this with reverence, even when exhausted by battle and weary from the field, is the duty of a Chaplain. It is his burden and satisfaction.”
  — Adeptus Astartes, The Book of Faith
Oration of Restoration.modifiers:
<orationOfRestoration cooldown="5" elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" rank="-1" rankMax="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints add="6"/>
										<addTrait duration="2" name="OrationOfRestoration"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</orationOfRestoration>

Omniscope.flavor: Centurions make use of omniscopes to better direct their fearsome firepower and pierce the gloom of a hostile galaxy.
Omniscope.modifiers:
<signum cooldown="5" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="SpaceMarines/Omniscope" requiredUpgrade="SpaceMarines/Omniscope">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="SpaceMarines/Omniscope"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</signum>

Signum.description: Negates the penalty for heavy, ordnance and salvo weapons.
Signum.flavor: The signum is a communication device that quickly processes and broadcasts targeting data. This ancient piece of technology allows one member of a Space Marine squad to fire with even greater accuracy, battering vital targets with a hail of unerring shots.
Signum.modifiers:
<signum cooldown="5" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" requiredUpgrade="SpaceMarines/Signum">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Relentless"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</signum>

Power of the Machine Spirit.flavor: The interface between this vehicle's advanced machine spirit and its fire control mechanisms allows the crew to target foes with incredible accuracy.
Power of the Machine Spirit.modifiers:
<powerOfTheMachineSpirit consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" requiredActionPoints="0" cooldown="5">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="PowerOfTheMachineSpirit"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</powerOfTheMachineSpirit>

Objuration Mechanicum.description: Curses the ranged weaponry of the target enemy unit. Also deals damage if the target is a vehicle or a fortification.
Objuration Mechanicum.flavor: Weapons jam and engines seize up as the telekine uses his powers to wrench and twist the inner workings at the hearts of nearby machines.
Objuration Mechanicum.modifiers:
<objurationMechanicum cooldown="2" levelUpPriority="0.1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit match="Any">
											<trait name="Fortification"/>
											<trait name="Vehicle"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints add="-6" addMax="-18"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="3" name="GetsHot"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</objurationMechanicum>

Shockwave.flavor: The psyker slams his palms together and the noise is magnified a hundredfold, releasing a shockwave that snaps bones and knocks foes from their feet.
Shockwave.modifiers:
<shockwave cooldown="2" levelUpPriority="0.2" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<attacks mulMin="0.33" mulMax="1.0"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1" excludeRadius="0">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<enemy/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<weaponDamage weapon="Shockwave"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</shockwave>

Levitate.description: Flies across obstacles to the target tile.
Levitate.flavor: The psyker uses his telekinetic powers to launch himself skywards, leaping across the battlefield in a single bound.
Levitate.modifiers:
<levitate cooldownMin="3" cooldownMax="1" rank="-1" rankMax="2">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<movement add="1"/>
						<movementMax add="1"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
		</levitate>

Telekine Dome.description: Creates a barrier on the tile of the Librarian and adjacent tiles that increases the ranged damage reduction.
Telekine Dome.flavor: Bullets bounce off of thin air and are deflected harmlessly away as the psyker erects a barrier of shimmering energy about himself.
Telekine Dome.modifiers:
<telekineDome cooldown="5" elite="1" levelUpPriority="0.3" rank="-1" rankMax="0">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="1" excludeRadius="0">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="3" name="TelekineDome"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="0">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier visible="0">
									<effects>
										<addFeature duration="3" name="TelekineDome"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</telekineDome>

Cluster Mines.description: Places cluster mines on the target adjacent tile to slow and damage enemies.
Cluster Mines.flavor: While operating behind enemy lines, Scout Bikers carry cluster mines—explosive devices crammed with tiny anti-personnel bomblets and triggered by tripwires or pressure sensors.
Cluster Mines.modifiers:
<clusterMines consumedMovement="0" cooldown="5" icon="Weapons/ClusterMines" requiredUpgrade="SpaceMarines/ClusterMines">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<land/>
							<noEnemyUnit/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addFeature name="ClusterMines"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</clusterMines>

Vectored Afterburners.description: Increases the movement and ranged damage reduction.
Vectored Afterburners.modifiers:
<vectoredAfterburners consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" cooldown="10">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="VectoredAfterburners"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</vectoredAfterburners>

Bolster Defences.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction of the target tile.
Bolster Defences.flavor:
“Every position must be held to the last man: there must be no retirement. With our backs to the wall, and believing in the justice of our cause, each one of us must fight on to the end.”
  — Imperial Warmaster Solon

Bonding Knife Ritual.flavor: Many T'au groupings undergo the solemn and bloody ceremony known as the ta'lissera. Those teams that share this bond swear to support one another at all costs for the rest of their lives.
Bonding Knife Ritual.modifiers:
<bondingKnifeRitual cooldown="10" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" requiredActionPoints="0" name="Tau/BondingKnifeRitual" requiredUpgrade="Tau/BondingKnifeRitual">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<morale add="100"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</bondingKnifeRitual>

Deploy %1%.description:
Deploys temporary %1%. Shares cooldown with other drone deployment abilities.

%2%
Deploy %1%.modifiers:
<deployGunDrone cooldown="10" name="Tau/DeployDrone" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" requiredUpgrade="Tau/GunDrone" unitType="Tau/GunDrone">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<noUnit/>
							<noFeature name="GravityWaves"/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addUnit name="Tau/GunDrone" consumedAction="0" consumedMovement="0"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="3" name="Summon"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
			<sharedCooldowns>
				<action name="Tau/DeployDrone/Tau/ShieldDrone"/>
				<action name="Tau/DeployDrone/Tau/MarkerDrone"/>
			</sharedCooldowns>
		</deployGunDrone>

Repair.description: Restores the hitpoints of the target allied vehicle, fortification or T'au unit.
Repair.flavor: For the Tyranids, it may be a slick of healing enzymes and symbiotes. For the Orks, a welding torch and WAAAGH! Power. For the T’au, hard advanced science. But every race has some capability for fixing the damage caused by combat and by the hostile world of Gladius Prime.
Repair.modifiers:
<repair cooldown="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<damaged/>
						</unit>
						<unit match="Any">
							<faction name="Tau"/>
							<trait name="Fortification"/>
							<trait name="Vehicle"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<hitpoints add="8"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</repair>

Construct Tidewall Gunrig.description: Heavily armed fortification that can be moved by transporting troops.
Construct Tidewall Gunrig.flavor: With its in-built rail weaponry, the Tidewall Gunrig provides the firepower to deal with heavy enemy assault units or advancing ranks of armour. Manned by hard-eyed Fire Warriors, these mobile turrets mount devastating railguns that are more than capable of ripping apart enemy tanks or monstrous beasts with volleys of hyper-sonic rounds.
Construct Tidewall Gunrig.modifiers:
<constructTidewallGunrig cooldown="10" icon="Units/Tau/TidewallGunrig" requiredUpgrade="Tau/TidewallGunrig">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<effects>
						<energyCost base="40"/>
						<oreCost base="40"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<noUnit/>
							<noFeature name="GravityWaves"/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addUnit name="Tau/TidewallGunrig"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</constructTidewallGunrig>

Markerlight.description: Increases the ranged accuracy of T'au against the target enemy non-fortification unit. Reduces the ranged damage reduction of the target enemy non-fortification unit against T'au. Ends after the target enemy unit is attacked by T'au.
Markerlight.flavor: A markerlight is a hand-held device that projects a simple beam onto a target which then transmits a torrent of targeting data to other T'au units, allowing them to engage the target with unerring accuracy.
Markerlight.modifiers:
<markerlight cooldown="1" name="Tau/Markerlight">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="2" lineOfSight="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<noTrait name="Tau/TargetAcquired"/>
							<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Tau/TargetAcquired"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</markerlight>

Volley Fire.description: Increases the ranged attacks of this unit and adjacent allied infantry units that have not moved.
Volley Fire.flavor: Under the constant eye of their Tutor, Fire Caste units learn to take cover, wait for the right moment and fire as one. The resulting volley of pulsed energy hits like neon fireworks and can thoroughly demoralize enemies.
Volley Fire.modifiers:
<genericUnitAbility passive="1" levelUpPriority="0.1" rank="-1" rankMax="2" name="Tau/VolleyFire">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Tile" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tau/VolleyFire"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>

Break Composure.description: This unit and adjacent allied infantry units cause attacked units to lose morale.
Break Composure.flavor: Though not physically impressive, the T’au can inculcate fear in their enemies through subtler means—by harrying them so that they can’t focus, by surrounding them, by forcing them down tactical paths that only lead to repeated failure. Sometimes you don’t need to even touch an enemy to defeat them.
Break Composure.modifiers:
<breakComposure cooldown="3" levelUpPriority="0.1" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="Tau/BreakComposure">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
											<noTrait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
											<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Tau/BreakComposure"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</breakComposure>

Precise Shot.description: Performs an uncompromising Pulse Rifle attack with increased accuracy, damage and range.
Precise Shot.flavor:
“I’m not going to teach you a special deathblow. I’m not going to give you a bigger gun. I’m not going to surround you with magic shield drones willing to die for you. But I am going to teach you to shoot straight, under fire, together. That immediately makes you better than every last Gue’la.”
  — Tutor Sharptongue
Precise Shot.modifiers:
<preciseShot cooldown="3" icon="Actions/Tau/PreciseShot" rank="-1" rankMax="2" weaponSlotName="PulseRifle" name="Tau/PreciseShot">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<effects>
						<accuracy mulMin="0.5" mulMax="1.5"/>
						<damage mulMin="0.5" mulMax="1.5"/>
						<rangeMax mulMin="0.5" mulMax="1.5"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
		</preciseShot>

Unity.description: Increases the loyalty output of all cities.
Unity.flavor: Though the Commanders are the icons of T’au propaganda, it is the Fireblades who are quietly regarded as the true heroes—warriors good enough to don Battle Suits who choose instead to stay with the rank and file, training them for the Greater Good. They are the true inspirations.
Unity.modifiers:
<genericUnitAbility passive="1" elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" rank="-1" rankMax="0" name="Tau/Unity">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tau/Unity"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>

Mont'ka (Killing Blow).description: Metastrategy that increases the damage of allied T'au units in the area against enemy units below 50% hitpoints. Shares cooldown with other metastrategies.
Mont'ka (Killing Blow).flavor:
“Your enemy builds his force carefully. At its centre, lie his core units. You feign weakness. You draw them out. And you focus your fire on them. Without them, the enemy is lost. Cut off the head, the beast dies. Well, except for Be’gel.”
  — Tutor Falsemoon
Mont'ka (Killing Blow).modifiers:
<montka cooldown="3" levelUpPriority="0.1" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="Tau/Montka">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<trait name="Tau/Ripyka"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<cooldown add="-1"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier visible="0">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<trait name="Tau/RipykaVa"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<cooldown add="-1"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>	
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affects="Unit" radius="3">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<faction name="Tau"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait duration="1" name="Tau/Montka"/>

								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>

			</beginTargets>
			<sharedCooldowns>
				<action name="Tau/Kauyon"/>
				<action name="Tau/Rinyon"/>
			</sharedCooldowns>
		</montka>

Kauyon (Patient Hunter).description: Metastrategy that increases the ranged damage reduction of allied T'au units in the area. Shares cooldown with other metastrategies.
Kauyon (Patient Hunter).flavor:
“Your troops are losing. They fall back! They flee! The enemy pursues, hungry for our valourous blood! Everything is lost… then your troops turn and fire. You reveal the flanking troops. And your enemy is in a pocket, encircled. The patient hunter triumphs.”
  — Tutor Falsemoon
Kauyon (Patient Hunter).modifiers:

Rinyon (Circle of Blades).description: Metastrategy that increases the accuracy of allied T'au units in the area against enemy units adjacent to other allied units. Shares cooldown with other metastrategies.
Rinyon (Circle of Blades).flavor:
“Your enemy encircles you. His troops are close. Too close. Your targeting network assigns every Fire Caste a victim, not his neighbour. You fire as one, every shot strikes, they fall as one. A distracted enemy is as good as dead.”
  — Tutor Falsemoon
Rinyon (Circle of Blades).modifiers:
<rinyon cooldown="3" levelUpPriority="0.1" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="Tau/Rinyon">

Rip'yka (Thousand Daggers).description: Reduces the cooldown of the Commander's metastrategies.
Rip'yka (Thousand Daggers).flavor:
“The enemy’s armour is thick, your blade makes only a scratch. In his arrogance, he allows you to strike. Hit the same spot, ten, a hundred, a thousand times. That scratch becomes a dent becomes a hole becomes his death. Water erodes the stone.”
  — Tutor Falsemoon
Rip'yka (Thousand Daggers).modifiers:
<genericUnitAbility elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" passive="1" rank="-1" rankMax="0" name="Tau/Ripyka">
			<beginTargets>

						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>

									<effects>
										<addTrait name="Tau/Ripyka"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</genericUnitAbility>

Sense of Stone.description: Increases the damage reduction of the Ethereal and adjacent allied T'au infantry and monstrous creatures. Shares cooldown with Storm of Fire.
Sense of Stone.flavor:
“There are only four thoughts the Fire Caste must know. Knowing when to hide. Knowing when to defend. Knowing when to mislead. And knowing when to strike. Ask nothing more.”
  — Aun’Dak’E, Curator of Spirit
Sense of Stone.modifiers:
<senseOfStone cooldown="1" levelUpPriority="0.1" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="Tau/SenseOfStone">

										<unit>
											<allied/>
											<faction name="Tau"/>
											<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
											<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>
									<effects>
										<addTrait durationMin="1" durationMax="3" name="Tau/SenseOfStone"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
			<sharedCooldowns>
				<action name="Tau/StormOfFire"/>
			</sharedCooldowns>
		</senseOfStone>

Storm of Fire.description: Increases the attacks of the Ethereal and adjacent allied T'au infantry and monstrous creatures. Shares cooldown with Sense of Stone.
Storm of Fire.flavor:
“It burns so briefly, the light of my children, so briefly. But, by the Greater Good, it burns so bright!”
  — Aun’Va, Master of the Undying Spirit
Storm of Fire.modifiers:
<stormOfFire cooldown="1" levelUpPriority="0.1" rank="-1" rankMax="2" requiredActionPoints="0" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" name="Tau/StormOfFire">

									</effects>
								</modifier>

				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
			<sharedCooldowns>
				<action name="Tau/SenseOfStone"/>
			</sharedCooldowns>
		</stormOfFire>

Calm of Tides.description: Restores the hitpoints of the Ethereal and adjacent allied T'au infantry and monstrous creatures.
Calm of Tides.flavor:
“Wait a moment. Breathe. Do not hurry to their salvation. All will come to the T’au eventually. Alive or dead.”
  — Aun’Dak’E, Curator of Spirit
Calm of Tides.modifiers:
<calmOfTides cooldown="3" levelUpPriority="0.1" rank="-1" rankMax="2" name="Tau/CalmOfTides">
			<beginTargets>

											<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
											<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>

								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</calmOfTides>

Zephyr's Grace.description: Increases the action points of this unit and adjacent allied T'au infantry and monstrous creatures.
Zephyr's Grace.flavor:
“Let none doubt that the Tau Empire will bring unity to all – let none doubt that now is our time. Forward, for the Greater Good!”
  — Aun’Va, Master of the Undying Spirit
Zephyr's Grace.modifiers:
<zephyrsGrace cooldown="10" elite="1" levelUpPriority="1" rank="-1" rankMax="0" name="Tau/ZephyrsGrace">

									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</zephyrsGrace>

Holophoton Countermeasures.description: Decreases the ranged accuracy of target enemy unit.
Holophoton Countermeasures.flavor: Triggered by AI-assisted threat-warning protocols, holophoton countermeasures take the form of a targeted barrage of holo-decoys, friendly target simulacra and stroboscopic blasts. Enemy weapons are confounded, safety-switches engaging and machine spirits rebelling while their operators are left bewildered and blinded by the overwhelming sensory overload.
Holophoton Countermeasures.modifiers:
<holophotonCountermeasures cooldown="5" consumedActionPoints="0" consumedMovement="0" requiredActionPoints="0" name="Tau/HolophotonCountermeasures">
			<beginTargets>

						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<noTrait name="Tau/HolophotonCountermeasures"/>

						<area affects="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>

									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</holophotonCountermeasures>

Gravity Wave Projector.flavor: This projector emits a high-powered graviton wave that repulses nearby enemies, slowing their advance to a crawl.

Nova Shield.description: Sacrifices hitpoints to increase the damage reduction.
Nova Shield.flavor: Though slightly unstable, the nova reactor is a dark-matter power source with an output akin to that of a small star.

Nova Fire.description: Sacrifices hitpoints to increase the attacks.
Nova Fire.flavor: Though slightly unstable, the nova reactor is a dark-matter power source with an output akin to that of a small star.
